result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

11:04 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Nicole J Berther in court by Zoom video means, in custody at Ozaukee County Jail, with attorney Nicholas Martinez.   Alyssa M Jay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Atty. Martinez provides an update, he notes that the defendant wishes to resolve the matter but due to defendant being in custody he is asking the matter be set for status. Based on the age of case 20CF1137 the Court will reset that matter for jury status and trial, and all other matters will tag along with for status.  Court advises counsel that if they would like to resolve the matter prior to the jury status date they can contact the clerk's office for a sooner date, but must file the plea questionnaire as well.  Hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.  Hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

08:54 AM; Case called for Hearing. Defendant Nicole J Berther in court with attorney Nicholas Martinez, as a friend of the Court.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Martinez advises that he should be appointed in this matter as he is appointed in the defendant's other matters. Atty. Martinez acknowledges recipt of the Criminal Complaint, waives reading, and  enters not guilty plea.  Atty. Martinez is asking that the defendant's oldest case, 20cf1137, be set for trial and all other matters tag along with.  All counsel argree the trial should take 1 day.  Court will set 20cf1137 for trial and this matter will tag along with.  Hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.  Hearing scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
